edu.umw.cpsc.humantrafficking
Class Route

java.lang.Object
  edu.umw.cpsc.humantrafficking.Route
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, sim.engine.Steppable
public class Route
extends java.lang.Object
implements sim.engine.Steppable

A Route represents a known pathway of human trafficking victims exploited by a trafficking network. Each Route has a source and destination location, plus zero or more intermediate transit locations. Routes know how to acquire victims, reacquire escapees, and move victims from one location to another.

See Also:

PROB_REACQUIRE_VICTIM

public static final double PROB_REACQUIRE_VICTIM
For each escaped victim, the annual probability that that victim will be reacquired by the system.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

Route

public Route(Location source,
             Location destination,
             int sourceVol,
             int destVol)
This constructor initializes a route with no transit locations.

Parameters:
source - the source Location.
destination - the destination Location.
sourceVol - an estimate of the number of newly abducted victims per year this source location is likely to produce.
destVol - an estimate of the number of victims per year this destination location is likely to acquire. This will be combined with sourceVol to determine an annual number of victims along this route.

Route

public Route(Location source,
             Location transit,
             Location destination,
             int sourceVol,
             int transitVol,
             int destVol)
This constructor initializes a route with one transit location. (Currently the simulation doesn't support multiple transit locations per route.)

Parameters:
source - the source Location.
transit - the (one) transit Location.
destination - the destination Location.
sourceVol - an estimate of the number of newly abducted victims per year this source location is likely to produce.
transitVol - an estimate of the number of victims per year likely to be transported through this transit location. This will be combined with sourceVol and destVol to determine an annual number of victims along this route.
destVol - an estimate of the number of victims per year this destination location is likely to acquire. This will be combined with transitVol and sourceVol to determine an annual number of victims.
Method Detail

step

public void step(sim.engine.SimState state)
Perform actions for this Route this year. Routes are scheduled to be run on Jan. 1st of each year. This includes the following main steps:
  1. Acquire victims from the source location, based (mostly) on its current population and (somewhat) on the strength of the demand on the destination side.
  2. Move victims along the route. If this route has a transit location, no victim can move from source to destination immediately in one year; the transit location will consume at least one year's time.
  3. Possibly reacquire escaped victims from all locations that are part of this route.

Specified by:
step in interface sim.engine.Steppable
Parameters:
state - the HumanTrafficking simulation.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Return a human-readable string representing this Route.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
